content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle!
For me, it's really hard to understand in first attempt

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a fun puzzle! Statement is clear, test cases are exhaustive and correct, can be solved pretty quickly.
This would be fun also in reverse mode!

Looks good! The only thing I would suggest is adding some test cases:

1) A test case where the some of the mirror sums have numbers with opposite  signs (Ex: 1 -2 -4 5 2)
2) A test case with N = 10 to fit the maximum constraint

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and clear chief

All sections
* Please refer to the explanation on formatting syntax here: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement

N, A and i should be formatted as [[variables]]. Line numbers and "One integer" should be formatted in <<bold>>.

Goal
* Please rewrite the task description so it does not reference array indexes directly, as this reveals part of a possible solution.

* Move the current "constraint" (which is actually part of the task explanation) into this section.

* Avoid using programming symbols like //; instead, describe in words.

Constraints
* Constraints define the valid input/output ranges and problem scope, which help players determine the required data types, algorithmic complexity and potential edge cases.

Please rewrite this section according to the above principles.

Cases
* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs and outputs. Please rewrite the cases accordingly, and feel free to include more than 4 pairs of cases if necessary.

Thanks.

Thank you very much for taking the time to review my contribution and for your detailed feedback — it’s really appreciated.

I’ve made sure to review all your suggestions and I’m ready to apply the necessary changes.
However, when I try to update the contribution, I keep getting the following error message:

“You do not have the last contribution version (#572)”

It seems that this prevents me from editing or saving my latest version.
Could you please advise me on how to resolve this issue, or if there’s another way to update my submission?
Thanks a lot! Glad you liked it

Thanks a lot to everyone who tested and commented!
I’ve added the latest suggested test cases and refined the contribution as per your feedback.

If you enjoyed the puzzle or found it interesting, feel free to give it an upvote  — and if everything looks good to you, an approval would be greatly appreciated too.

Your feedback and support really help me improve. 

Thanks again for your time!

Thanks a lot for the suggestion!
I’ve just added the reverse mode — it really fits this puzzle well and makes it more fun to play.
Appreciate your feedback and support!
Would checking the title help you guess what the program is doing, or is it still unclear?
Thank you for the puzzle!
Just refresh the page. But copy what you need on the page before refreshing, otherwise you'll lose what you have.
the changes have now been applied.

The contribution looks much better now! Just several more changes:

Goal
* Please format "N" as a [[variable]].

* Please add ", i.e. the first with the last, the second with the second-to-last, and so on" after "opposite end".

* Please add a note to the end:
Note: When [[N]] is odd, the middle integer is considered to be mirrored with itself.

Constraints
* Please change "number" to "element in the sequence".

* The limits should be more reflective of the actual cases. Hence:

  • Please change 100 to 10.
  
  • Please change -1000 to -100.
  
  • Please change 1000 to 100.

Cases
* Please revise Test 1 to better illustrate the task. In the current input 1 2 3 4, both mirrored sums are equal (1 + 4 = 2 + 3), which doesn't clearly highlight the objective of finding the largest mirrored sum.

* Please add a new pair of cases where N = 1 and the only element is greater than 50.

Thanks.
All the requested changes have been added — the goal, constraints, test 1 and new test/validator for the single-element case are now updated.
Looks good to me. Thank you.

Thanks a lot for your help and feedback during the review!
If everything looks good to you now, could you please approve the contribution so it can move forward?
I haven't tried writing a solution myself, so I'm not in a position to approve the contribution. Also, I'd like more people to review the contribution first. Hope that's ok.
No worries, thanks for taking the time to check it!
